bug.author: sevagh
bug.summary: Can't install mlpack on Fedora 30 due to Boost version mismatch (1.69.0 vs 1.66.0
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>Issue description</denchmark-h>
When trying to install mlpack, mlpack-devel, mlpack-bin on Fedora 30, I get: <denchmark-code>Problem 2: conflicting requests - nothing provides libboost_program_options.so.1.66.0 needed by mlpack-2.2.5-8.fc30.i686 - nothing provides libboost_serialization.so.1.66.0 needed by mlpack-2.2.5-8.fc30.i686 - nothing provides libboost_program_options.so.1.66.0()(64bit) needed by mlpack-2.2.5-8.fc30.x86_64 - nothing provides libboost_serialization.so.1.66.0()(64bit) needed by mlpack-2.2.5-8.fc30.x86_64 </denchmark-code>
The version of Boost in Fedora 30 is 1.69: <denchmark-code>shanssian:build $ sudo dnf --showduplicates list boost Last metadata expiration check: 0:30:55 ago on Tue 23 Jul 2019 10:13:32 AM EDT. Installed Packages boost.x86_64 1.69.0-8.fc30 @updates Available Packages boost.i686 1.69.0-6.fc30 fedora boost.x86_64 1.69.0-6.fc30 fedora boost.i686 1.69.0-8.fc30 updates boost.x86_64 1.69.0-8.fc30 updates </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h4>Your environment</denchmark-h>
version of mlpack: 2.2.5-8.fc30 operating system: Fedora 30 compiler: gcc version of dependencies (Boost/Armadillo): Boost = 1.69.0 any other environment information you think is relevant:

comments.comment: Thanks for the report---weird that the boost maintainers did not rebuild the mlpack package for the boost upgrade (they usually do). In any case I am actively working on upgrading the mlpack Fedora package to mlpack 3, but that requires ensmallen to be present in the Fedora repositories as it is a new dependency. But ensmallen just went into the stable repos a day or two ago so now I can finish the upgrade process. I'll keep you updated and let you know how to install the package even before it gets to stable. üëç
Thanks! Meanwhile I can unblock myself by building from source (but also running into <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/issues/1928>#1928</denchmark-link> )

Ok, here's the update for mlpack 3.1.0: <denchmark-link:https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2019-8ca6d0ca5c>https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2019-8ca6d0ca5c</denchmark-link>
But, stupidly, I realized that I had built these RPMs for an older version (now 3.1.1 is out but it's basically the same). I think (but am not 100% sure) that you can get the package just by doing <denchmark-code>dnf install mlpack --enablerepo=updates-testing </denchmark-code>
though maybe you want some of the other related packages like mlpack-bin, mlpack-devel, mlpack-python, or mlpack-python3, or maybe mlpack-doc. Let me know if there are any issues. And probably the 3.1.1 update will also be pushed in the next day or two... just waiting on the rebuilds now...

Great: <denchmark-code>sevagh:~ $ sudo dnf install mlpack mlpack-bin mlpack-devel --enablerepo=updates-testing Last metadata expiration check: 0:00:40 ago on Sun 04 Aug 2019 07:16:44 AM EDT.
